data.title: Norma Dean Morse
data.meta_description: Norma Dean Morse went home to be with the Lord Wednesday night, December 30, 2015, in Longmont, Colorado, following an extended illness. She was born in Indianapolis, Indiana on May 31, 1929, to Frederick Curtis and D Frances (Cooper) Wasson. Norma was raised in Hartsville, Indiana and was the oldest of four girls. ...
data.text:
Norma Dean Morse went home to be with the Lord Wednesday night, December 30, 2015, in Longmont, Colorado, following an extended illness. She was born in Indianapolis, Indiana on May 31, 1929, to Frederick Curtis and D Frances (Cooper) Wasson. Norma was raised in Hartsville, Indiana and was the oldest of four girls. Norma attended Butler University and Minnesota Bible College where she met the love of her life, Robert Stanley Morse, whom she married on August 5, 1950, in Columbus, Indiana. After raising three children, Norma worked as a substitute teacher and later retired from the Marion County Health Department. She was a devoted mother and wife, serving tirelessly in the church alongside her husband. Norma sang, played the piano, taught Bible classes, and cooked at church camp. She was considered "Mama Morse" by several who benefited from her compassion, teaching, and encouragement. She showed hospitality to all. In short, Norma loved her family and she loved the Lord. She is survived by her "mugwumps" Robert Morse, her sisters, D. Joanne Ogilvie of Macon, GA, and Donna Louise (Robert) Torrence, and her children, Paul Stephen (Becca) Morse of Granger, Indiana, Rhoda Elizabeth Elrod of Longmont, CO, and Julia Wasson (Ken) Toler of Littleton, CO. She is also survived by grandchildren: Tammy (Chad) Christian, Monica (Eric) Lassen, Sherry (Randy) Whitehill, Michael (Emily) Morse, Phoebe (Ryan) Heather, Ezra (Kelsey) Elrod, Katie (Samuel) Helgeson Toler, Melissa Ann Elrod, Charles Sidney Toler, Tracey (Ed) Lloyd and Stephanie (Todd) Shearer twenty great grandchildren and many nieces and nephews. Norma was preceded in death by her parents, sister R. Sue Wasson Query, brothers-in-law, Max Ogilvie and Tony Query, and nephew David Ogilvie. Memorial service is to be on January 16th at Mt. Gilead Church 6019 E State Road 144 in Mooresville Indiana at 1 PM.

In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the mission work in Chennai, India through World Bible School of Tulare County, PO Box 3700, Visalia, CA 93278-3700 or Hospice Boulder TRU Community Care Lafayette CO 80026
